titles.title: How Blest Is He Whose Trespass

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: How blest is he whose trespass hath freely been forgiv'n, whose sin is wholly covered before the sight of heav'n. to whom the LORD in mercy imputeth not his sin, who hath a guileless spirit, whose heart is true within.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: While I kept guilty silence my strength was spent with grief: Thy hand was heavy on me, my soul found no relief; but when I owned my trespass, my sin hid not from Thee; when I confessed transgression, then Thou forgavest me.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: So let the godly seek Thee in times when Thou art near; no whelming floods shall reach them nor cause their hearts to fear. In Thee, O LORD, I hid me; Thou savest me from ill, and songs of Thy salvation my heart with rapture thrill.
